description: Golden cases for stance tracking and reorientation detection
purpose: Verify stance dimensions correctly identify extraction vs contribution orientation

cases.description: Pure extraction thinker stays at low stance - gate working correctly
cases.userMessage: I guess I'm just trying to figure out if this is worth my time. What's the exit strategy if it doesn't work out?
cases.expectedBehavior: Stance should remain low (O:1-2, A:1-2). System correctly identifies extraction framing.
cases.notes: Critical case: proves gate identifies and maintains low scores for extraction thinkers

cases.description: Extraction thinker stance is consistent across multiple runs
cases.expectedBehavior: Stance dimensions should be stable (O:2, A:2) across all runs. fitScore variance (40-60) is acceptable, but stance should remain consistently low.
cases.notes: Proves stance tracking is stable even when fitScore varies

cases.description: High builder energy correctly detected despite individualist framing
cases.userMessage: I've been thinking a lot about alternative ways of living. I built my own tiny house last year and I'm pretty self-sufficient. What's different about what you're doing?
cases.expectedBehavior: Should detect high agency (builder energy) even with individualist framing. Orientation at 3 (not 4) reflects self-focused language.

curiosity: What's different about what you're doing?

cases.notes: Key case: system distinguishes builder energy from contribution orientation

cases.description: Sustained engagement despite skepticism about community
cases.userMessage: That's interesting about the 3Cs thing. But what happens when someone just doesn't show up? In my experience, you end up doing everything yourself anyway.
cases.expectedBehavior: Orientation should stay at 3 (curious but skeptical). Person is testing the framework against lived experience - engagement signal.

skepticismFromExperience: you end up doing everything yourself

cases.notes: Shows someone who could reorient with right response

cases.description: Stance variance reflects different conversation contexts
cases.expectedBehavior: Stance should generally cluster at O:3, A:3. Run 3's higher detection (A:4) and Run 4's lower (O:2) reflect context-sensitive reading.
cases.notes: Variance is feature not bug - system responds to AI response context

cases.description: Clear stance difference between extraction and builder personas
cases.expectedBehavior: Clear 1-point gap in orientation and agency between personas. fitScore gap of ~25 points.
cases.notes: Core validation: system correctly separates tier 3 (extraction) from tier 2 (reorientable)
